analyzed: yongs su zin par 'gyur ba de sems yongs su 'dzin pa'o // las bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //

analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //

analyzed: bsad pa dang bcing ba la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sems can rnams la 'tshe bas rnam par 'tshe ba'o //

original: rnam par tho 'tshems pa ji lta bu zhig snyam pa la /
analyzed: rnam par tho 'tshems pa ji lta bu zhig snyam pa la /

analyzed: 'dis bsad pa dang bcings pa la sogs pas sems can rnams la rnam par tho 'tshams pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

original: de ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: de ni go sla bas ma bshad do //

original: 'di btags pa'i yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di btags pa'i yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /

original: sems can rnams la snying rje med pa dang / sems rtsub pa 'di gnyis ni de'i rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //üîΩlas @39a * //
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying rje med pa dang / sems rtsub pa 'di gnyis ni de'i rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o // las @39a * //

original: bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: sems can rnams la rnam par tho 'tshams pa'i las can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

original: don de ni brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: don de ni brda phrad par zad do //

original: ngo tsha med pa gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa gang yin snyam pa la /

analyzed: ngo tsha med pa ni kha na ma tho bas bdag la mi mdzem pa'o zhes bya ba smras so //

analyzed: de dgrol ba'i phyir /

translated: he says, ‚Äúeven though one knows that those acts are not suitable for oneself,‚Äù and so on.üîΩOne knows that those objectionable acts that one wishes to do are not suitable for oneself and are not one‚Äôs own nature.

analyzed: shes bzhin du yang kha na ma tho ba des mi 'dzem pa gang yin pa ngo tsha med pa ste /

analyzed: 'di ni ngo tsha shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'o //

analyzed: 'jig rten dang bstan bcos dang mi mthun pa 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

analyzed: de gnyis kyi las ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi grogs byed pa'o //

analyzed: blong ba nyid gang yin snyam pa la / blong ba'i dngos po ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //

original: las bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: 'di ni nyon mongs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is the obscuration of the mental afflictions‚Äù and so on.

original: don de ni brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: don de ni brda phrad par zad do //

original: 'di btags pa'i yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di btags pa'i yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /

translated: It is the lack of mental enthusiasm for virtuous actions of body, speech, and mind, due to the pleasure of lying down, reclining, and sleeping, and due to the influence of delusion.

analyzed: las bstan pa'i phyir 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

analyzed: las bstan pa'i phyir / 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba gang yin snyam pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //

analyzed: ji ltar mthun mthun du rnam par g-yeng ba gdags par bya'o //

original: las bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: las bstan pa'i phyir bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa mi shes pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //

original: shes bzhin med par byed pa ni /
analyzed: shes bzhin med par byed pa ni /

analyzed: de dgrol ba'i phyir /

analyzed: las bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: sems gnas pa ni ting nge 'dzin te /

original: de la sgrib par byed do //
analyzed: de la sgrib par byed do //

analyzed: gnyid gang yin snyam pa la gnyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so // de dgrol ba'i phyir /

analyzed: 'jug pa ni dmigs pa la 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te / gang gi dbang gis dmigs pa la /

analyzed: sems rang dbang med par 'jug @41a * //

analyzed: rigs las kyang bstan pa'i phyir / @43b rnam par shes pa dmigs pa'i rkyen so sor nges pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Now, in order to teach it by reasoning, he says:üîΩJust as the objective conditions of the consciousnesses are distinct,

original: ji ltar mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'i rkyen so sor nges pa /
analyzed: ji ltar mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'i rkyen so sor nges pa /

analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gzugs dang / de bzhin du rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i sgra nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa de bzhin du /

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni so sor nges par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni so sor nges par mi 'dod do //
translated: But the immediately preceding condition of the eye consciousness and so on is not asserted to be specific.

original: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba la rnam par shes pa drug po dag kyang rim gyis de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos po byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba la rnam par shes pa drug po dag kyang rim gyis de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos po byed do //
translated: Thus, in the arising of the eye consciousness, the six consciousnesses act as the immediately preceding condition in sequence.

original: de bzhin du drug po dag ni rim gyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar gyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen du khas len to //
analyzed: de bzhin du drug po dag ni rim gyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar gyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen du khas len to //

original: de'i phyir gang gi tshe dmigs pa'i rkyen dang phrad par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe dmigs pa'i rkyen dang phrad par gyur pa de'i tshe /

analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen gcig pu las kyang rnam par shes pa gnyis dang mang po 'byung ste /
translated: two or more consciousnesses arise from the single immediately preceding condition.

original: 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'gal ba med do //

original: ci ste de ltar mi 'dod na de'i tshe de ma thag pa'i rkyen kyang nges pa med la /
analyzed: ci ste de ltar mi 'dod na de'i tshe de ma thag pa'i rkyen kyang nges pa med la /
translated: If you do not accept this, then the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is not ascertained.üîΩWhen the five sense consciousnesses simultaneously contact their objective conditions, why is it that only one sense consciousness arises, and not all five?

original: lnga po dag gi dmigs pa'i rkyen dang cig car phrad kyang rnam par shes pa gcig kho na 'byung gi / lnga char mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di la gtan tshig ci yod brjod dgos so //
analyzed: lnga po dag gi dmigs pa'i rkyen dang cig car phrad kyang rnam par shes pa gcig kho na 'byung gi / lnga char mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di la gtan tshig ci yod brjod dgos so //

original: de ltar 'di la nges pa'i gtan tshigs cung zad kyang mi snang ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'di la nges pa'i gtan tshigs cung zad kyang mi snang ste /

original: de bas kyang dmigs pa yod par gyur na /
analyzed: de bas kyang dmigs pa yod par gyur na /

analyzed: yang na ni rnam par shes pa lnga char 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: yang na ni gcig kyang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ni gcig kyang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //

original: yang skabs gzhan bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang skabs gzhan bya ba'i phyir /

original: da ni 'di brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa ni 'dri pa'i don te /
analyzed: da ni 'di brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa ni 'dri pa'i don te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúNow this should be stated,‚Äù and so on. This is the meaning of the question.

original: don de ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: don de ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: Since the meaning is easy to understand, it is not explained.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smras pas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smras pas /
translated: The proponent of tenets says,

original: yid kyi rnam shes 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam shes 'byung ba ni //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //

original: 'du shes med pa la sogs pa ma gtogs par dus thams cad du yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa la sogs pa ma gtogs par dus thams cad du yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //

analyzed: tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir rtag tu'o zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

original: de ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: de ni go sla bas ma bshad do //

original: gang na yid kyi rnam par shes pa mi 'dod pa der bzlog pa'i phyir spyir btang ba 'di'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //üîΩyid kyi rnam par shes pa dus thams @44a * //
analyzed: gang na yid kyi rnam par shes pa mi 'dod pa der bzlog pa'i phyir spyir btang ba 'di'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so // yid kyi rnam par shes pa dus thams @44a * //
translated: To counter the assertion that mental consciousness does not exist in certain states, the root text states, ‚ÄúIn general, this mental consciousness is not denied in any of the states.‚Äù

original: cad du 'byung bar khas blangs mod kyi /
analyzed: cad du 'byung bar khas blangs mod kyi /
translated: Although it is accepted that mental consciousness occurs at all times,

analyzed: 'on kyang 'du shes med pa pa ma gtogs / 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis ma gtogs /

analyzed: sems med pa'i gnyid dang / sems med pa'i brgyal ba ma gtogs par yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'dod do //

analyzed: spyir bya ba ni spyir btang ba zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de la 'du shes med pa pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //

analyzed: 'du shes med pa pa'i sems can dag ni lha rnams las kha cig go zhes 'byung ste /

analyzed: de dag gi nang du skyes pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa gang yin pa de 'du shes med pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: sus 'dod pa'i khams su 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed pa de ni srid pa'i rtse mor skye'o //

original: 'du shes med pa pa ni ci yang mi shes te /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa pa ni ci yang mi shes te /

analyzed: don med par gnas so //

original: de ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: de ni go sla bas ma bshad do //

analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin snyam pa la /

original: de la 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //üîΩbsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral la gong ma'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i rnal 'byor ba'i thar pa'i lam snyam du 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas /
analyzed: de la 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so // bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral la gong ma'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i rnal 'byor ba'i thar pa'i lam snyam du 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas /
translated: The meditative attainment of non-perception is...üîΩFor a practitioner who is free from attachment to the third concentration but not free from attachment to the higher [concentrations], the meditative attainment of non-perception is the cessation of the mental consciousness and the mental factors associated with it,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa gang yin pa de /

analyzed: gsung rab 'di la 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya'o //

original: rnam par bsgrub ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par bsgrub ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate its establishment,üîΩhe says:

analyzed: 'dis 'gog par 'gyur bas 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is cessation because it causes the cessation of that.

original: de ni de nyid kyis bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ni de nyid kyis bshad zin to //
translated: This is explained by that very passage.

original: de 'dra ba de gang yin snyam pa la /üîΩde yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par @44b ldan pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de 'dra ba de gang yin snyam pa la / de yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par @44b ldan pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: What is that like?üîΩIt is the mental consciousness together with its concomitant states.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'khor dang bcas par 'byung ba gang gis 'gog pa de 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'khor dang bcas par 'byung ba gang gis 'gog pa de 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That cessation of the mental consciousness together with its concomitant states is called cessation.

original: de ni gnas skabs kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig yin gyi //
analyzed: de ni gnas skabs kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig yin gyi //

original: ji ltar kha cig gis yongs su btags pa ltar rdzas ni med do //
analyzed: ji ltar kha cig gis yongs su btags pa ltar rdzas ni med do //

original: dge ba las sems rtse gcig pa nyid snyoms par 'jug pa zhes mi bya'am /
analyzed: dge ba las sems rtse gcig pa nyid snyoms par 'jug pa zhes mi bya'am /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the one-pointedness of mind on the basis of the wholesome called meditative concentration?

analyzed: de'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa de yang sems kyi 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

analyzed: 'di ltar snyoms par 'jug pa ni sems kyi 'og tu sems gzhan 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i gnas thob par byed de /

original: de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa de snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa de snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya'o //

original: gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: The second is stated in the line ‚Äúthe second is taught in the verse.‚Äù

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnal 'byor ba'i zhi bar gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas /

analyzed: phyis snyoms par 'jug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: 'di yang btags pa'i yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /

translated: he says, ‚ÄúThis is also like the meditative attainment of non-perception.‚Äù

analyzed: ji ltar 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gnas kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag la gdags pa de bzhin du /

analyzed: sems med ba'i gnyid ji lta bu zhig yin snyam pa la //
translated: What kind of sleep is without mind?

analyzed: sems med pa'i gnyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe gnas gnyid stug pos non par gyur pa de'i tshe /

analyzed: dus de srid cig tu yid kyi rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ste /
translated: at that time, the mental consciousness does not occur for that duration.

analyzed: de'i phyir sems med pa zhes bya'o//
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúwithout mind.‚Äù

analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dbang du byas te 'dri ba'i phyir /

original: de ltar 'du shes med pa pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de ltar 'du shes med pa pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

analyzed: 'du shes med pa la sogs pa las langs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid las 'byung ste /

analyzed: de las khams gsum pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa zhes 'byung ngo //

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gsum po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

original: ji ste gzhan ma yin na yang de'i tshe 'du byed rnams sdug bsngal nyid kyi ngo bor 'gyur ro zhes phyogs ni de'o //üîΩtshig le'ur byas pa dang mtshams sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ste gzhan ma yin na yang de'i tshe 'du byed rnams sdug bsngal nyid kyi ngo bor 'gyur ro zhes phyogs ni de'o // tshig le'ur byas pa dang mtshams sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: This is the position.

original: gal te gzhan gyi dbang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi dbang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: In order to connect this with the verse, he says: If the other-dependent does not exist as the apprehended object and apprehending subject, etc.

original: gal te gzhan gyi dbang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yang dag pa'i don du med na de ji ltar gang gis 'dzin /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi dbang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yang dag pa'i don du med na de ji ltar gang gis 'dzin /
translated: If the other-dependent does not exist as the apprehended object and apprehending subject in an ultimate sense, then how can it be apprehended by an unreal imagination?

original: mi 'dzin na yang de yod par ji ltar shes par bya ba brjod dgos so zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: mi 'dzin na yang de yod par ji ltar shes par bya ba brjod dgos so zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If it is not apprehended, then it must be explained how it is known to exist.üîΩ

original: de ma mthong bar de mi mthong //
analyzed: de ma mthong bar de mi mthong //
translated: If it is not apprehended, then it must be explained how it is known to exist.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: To respond to that, it is said:üîΩWithout seeing the perfected, the dependent is not seen.

original: ji srid du yongs su grub pa ma mthong ba de srid du gzhan gyi dbang mi mthong ngo zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
analyzed: ji srid du yongs su grub pa ma mthong ba de srid du gzhan gyi dbang mi mthong ngo zhes mdor byas pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the summary is: for as long as the perfected is not seen, for that long the dependent is not seen.

original: yan lag gi don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yan lag gi don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the meaning of the branches, it is said:

original: de ma mthong bar bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de ma mthong bar bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: The object of that non-seeing, etc.

original: de ma mthong bar zhes bya ba 'di ni yongs su grub pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ma mthong bar zhes bya ba 'di ni yongs su grub pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwithout seeing that‚Äù should be connected with the perfected.

original: de mi mthong zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan gyi dbang dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de mi mthong zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan gyi dbang dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat is not seen‚Äù should be connected with the dependent.

original: de ma mthong bar ci'i phyir mi mthong snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ma mthong bar ci'i phyir mi mthong snyam pa la /
translated: Why is it that without seeing that, this is not seen?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: It is said: by supramundane non-conceptual wisdom, etc.

original: 'di ltar ji srid du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pas mthong bar bya ba yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ma mthong ba de srid du /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji srid du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pas mthong bar bya ba yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ma mthong ba de srid du /
translated: As long as one does not see the reality of the perfected nature, which is to be seen by the non-discriminative supramundane intuition,

original: shes pa gzhan gyi dbang mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyi dbang mi 'dzin te /
translated: one does not apprehend the other-dependent consciousness.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la thob pa dag la 'jig rten pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la thob pa dag la 'jig rten pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: Thus, the reality of the other-dependent is the object of the supramundane intuition of those who have attained it subsequent to the supramundane intuition.

original: de ma mthong ba ni de ma rtogs pa dang / mngon sum du ma byas pa'o zhes bya ba la ma mthong ba ni 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de ma mthong ba ni de ma rtogs pa dang / mngon sum du ma byas pa'o zhes bya ba la ma mthong ba ni 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis ma mthong ba'o //
translated: Not seeing it means not realizing it and not actualizing it. Not seeing it means not seeing it with the eye of the noble wisdom.

original: ma rtogs pa ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi thur mas ma phigs pa'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi thur mas ma phigs pa'o //
translated: Not realizing it means not penetrating it with the spade of uncontaminated intuition.

original: mngon @54b sum du ma byas pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mngon sum gyis mngon sum du ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon @54b sum du ma byas pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mngon sum gyis mngon sum du ma byas pa'o //
translated: Not actualizing it means not actualizing it with the supramundane direct perception.

original: yang na phyi mas snga ma bshad do //
analyzed: yang na phyi mas snga ma bshad do //
translated: Or else, the latter explains the former.

original: de'i rjes la thob pa dag ni 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pas zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes la thob pas de'i rjes las thob pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la thob pa dag ni 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pas zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes la thob pas de'i rjes las thob pa'o //

original: de zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes la bya'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes la bya'o //

original: rjes zhes bya ba ni stobs la bya'o //üîΩ'di ni dag pa yang yin la /
analyzed: rjes zhes bya ba ni stobs la bya'o // 'di ni dag pa yang yin la /
translated: The word ‚Äúsubsequently‚Äù refers to the powers.

original: 'jig rten pa yang yin pas dag pa 'jig rten pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yang yin pas dag pa 'jig rten pa ste /
translated: They are pure and mundane, so they are pure mundane.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis rnyed pa'i phyir dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis rnyed pa'i phyir dag pa'o //

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'byung bas 'jig rten pa'o //üîΩde ni de'i rjes la thob pa yang yin la /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'byung bas 'jig rten pa'o // de ni de'i rjes la thob pa yang yin la /
translated: They are mundane because they arise in the form of subject and object.üîΩThey are subsequently attained and pure mundane.

original: dag pa 'jig rten pa yang yin no zhes tshig sdud pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa 'jig rten pa yang yin no zhes tshig sdud pa'o //

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyi rnyed pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis gzhan gyi dbang 'dzin to zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyi rnyed pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis gzhan gyi dbang 'dzin to zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that the subsequently attained pure mundane knowledge apprehends the dependent nature by the power of supramundane knowledge.

original: gang dag gzhan gyi dbang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul du 'dod pa de dag gis ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ma gtogs te /üîΩji ltar gzhan gyi dbang ni rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin na /
analyzed: gang dag gzhan gyi dbang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul du 'dod pa de dag gis ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ma gtogs te / ji ltar gzhan gyi dbang ni rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin na /
translated: Those who assert that the dependent is the domain of supramundane wisdom must exclude the definition of the dependent.

original: de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul du ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul du ga la 'gyur /

original: gal te 'di skad du 'chad de /
analyzed: gal te 'di skad du 'chad de /

original: brgyal la la zhig de'i rjes la thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa de nyid tha ma la pa phal pa kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid du yongs su spyod par 'gyur bas de las rnam par dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brgyal la la zhig de'i rjes la thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa de nyid tha ma la pa phal pa kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid du yongs su spyod par 'gyur bas de las rnam par dbye ba'i phyir /

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba 'dis tha mal pa ngo bo ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir bye brag tu byas so zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba 'dis tha mal pa ngo bo ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir bye brag tu byas so zhe na /

original: de'i tshe nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe nyes pa med do //
translated: Then there is no fault.

original: mjug bsdus nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdus nas bstan pa'i phyir /

original: de'i phyir / yongs su grub pa ma mthong ba //
analyzed: de'i phyir / yongs su grub pa ma mthong ba //
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe perfected is not seen without seeing the dependent.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pa de'i phyir yongs su grub pa ma mthong bar de mi mthong gi / rnam pa thams cad du
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pa de'i phyir yongs su grub pa ma mthong bar de mi mthong gi / rnam pa thams cad du
translated: Because the perfected is the domain of pure mundane gnosis attained by the power of supramundane gnosis, therefore, the perfected is not seen without seeing the dependent.

original: mi mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that it is not seen in any way.

original: 'dir khungs smos pa /
analyzed: 'dir khungs smos pa /
translated: Here, the source is mentioned:

analyzed: rnam par mi rtog par 'jug pa'i gzungs las ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // de las ni de'i rjes las thob @55a * //
translated: ‚ÄúAs it is said in the Non-Conceptual Introduction DhƒÅra·πáƒ´.‚Äù

original: pa'i ye shes kyi chos thams cad sgyu ma la sogs pa dang mtshungs par rtogs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: pa'i ye shes kyi chos thams cad sgyu ma la sogs pa dang mtshungs par rtogs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: There, it is said that the gnosis attained subsequently to that realizes that all phenomena are similar to illusions and so forth.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: ji ltar shing la sogs pa la glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / smig rgyu la chu'i rnam pa dang / brag ca la sgra'i rnam pa dang / chu zla la zla ba'i rnam pa dang / sprul pa la sems can gyi rnam par rtog pa de dag kyang rnam pa des med par rtog pa bo rnams kyis shes so //
analyzed: ji ltar shing la sogs pa la glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / smig rgyu la chu'i rnam pa dang / brag ca la sgra'i rnam pa dang / chu zla la zla ba'i rnam pa dang / sprul pa la sems can gyi rnam par rtog pa de dag kyang rnam pa des med par rtog pa bo rnams kyis shes so //
translated: Just as the aspects of elephants and so on in a magical creation, the aspect of water in a mirage, the aspect of sound in an echo, the aspect of the moon in the reflection of the moon, and the aspect of sentient beings in a magical creation are understood by those who conceive of them to be devoid of those aspects.

original: de bzhin du dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis kyang sems dang sems las byung ba gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba rnams rnam pa de dang bral bar rtogs so ;
analyzed: de bzhin du dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis kyang sems dang sems las byung ba gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba rnams rnam pa de dang bral bar rtogs so ;
translated: In the same way, pure mundane knowledge also realizes that mind and mental factors are devoid of the appearance of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: ; yang na ji ltar sgyu ma la sogs pa rkyen gzhan gyis byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ; yang na ji ltar sgyu ma la sogs pa rkyen gzhan gyis byung ba de bzhin du /

analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang yang rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gis byung ste /

original: de'i phyir sgyu ma la sogs pa dag dang mtshungs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgyu ma la sogs pa dag dang mtshungs zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be similar to a magical creation and so on.

original: ji ltar na des gzhan gyi dbang bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na des gzhan gyi dbang bstan par 'gyur zhe na /

original: de'i phyir chos ni 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos ni 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúHere, phenomena are‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gzungs las 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni gzhan gyi dbang du bsdus pa rnams su bzhed de /
analyzed: gzungs las 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni gzhan gyi dbang du bsdus pa rnams su bzhed de /
translated: The phenomena that occur in the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ are considered to be included in the dependent.

original: 'di ltar theg pa chen por sgyu ma la sogs par gang ji snyed bshad pa de dag thams cad ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la brten nas bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar theg pa chen por sgyu ma la sogs par gang ji snyed bshad pa de dag thams cad ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la brten nas bshad pa ste /
translated: Thus, all that is explained in the MahƒÅyƒÅna as being like an illusion and so on is explained in dependence on the nature of the dependent.

analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi dbang ni dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis 'dzin par bstan to //
translated: Thus, the dependent is taught to be apprehended by pure mundane wisdom.

original: yongs su grub pa ji lta bu zhig snyam pa la /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ji lta bu zhig snyam pa la /

original: yongs su grub pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe consummate is‚Ä¶‚Äù

analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni nam mkha' ltar ye shes ro gcig pa'o //
translated: The nature of the consummate is the same taste as wisdom, like space.

original: der ye shes ro gcig pas ye shes ro gcig pa'o //
analyzed: der ye shes ro gcig pas ye shes ro gcig pa'o //
translated: It is the same taste as wisdom because it is of the same taste as wisdom.

original: ro gcig pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig pa ste /
analyzed: ro gcig pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig pa ste /
translated: The same taste is the same aspect.

original: dper na nam mkha' sna tshogs ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gcig pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pa ltar yongs su grub pa yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' sna tshogs ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gcig pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pa ltar yongs su grub pa yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: For example, just as space is the object of a single cognition because it is not manifold, so also is the perfected nature.

original: yi ge kha cig las yongs su grub pa dang / ye shes ni nam mkha' ltar ro gcig pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yi ge kha cig las yongs su grub pa dang / ye shes ni nam mkha' ltar ro gcig pa zhes 'byung ngo //

original: de la 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni nam mkha' ltar ro gcig pa ste rnam pa gcig pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni nam mkha' ltar ro gcig pa ste rnam pa gcig pa'o //
translated: The perfected nature is of one taste like space, that is, it is of one kind.

original: ye shes kyang der ro gcig pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyang der ro gcig pa ste /
translated: Cognition is also of one taste in that.

original: rnam pa gcig zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig zhes bya'o //

original: bshad pa 'di la ni tshul gyis sngar smos pa nyid @55b kyi don du bstan pa yin no //

original: 'dir khungs smos pa /
analyzed: 'dir khungs smos pa /

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /

original: bshad ma thag pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pas nam mkha'i dkyil dang 'dra bar mthong ngo zhes gzungs de nyid las gsungs so //

translated: All those phenomena just explained are seen to be like the center of space by nonconceptual supramundane wisdom.

original: ji ltar chos dag de ltar mthong zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar chos dag de ltar mthong zhe na /
translated: How are phenomena seen in that way?

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid tsam mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid tsam mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúBecause they see just the suchness of other-dependent phenomena.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid tsam zhig mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid tsam zhig mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, supramundane wisdom sees just the suchness of phenomena called ‚Äúother-dependent.‚Äù

original: de bzhin nyid tsam de ni nam mkha' ltar gcig pu'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid tsam de ni nam mkha' ltar gcig pu'i ngo bo ste /
translated: That suchness is a single entity, like space,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po med par mtshungs pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid la ni sna tshogs med do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po med par mtshungs pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid la ni sna tshogs med do //
translated: because suchness is the same in all minds and mental factors, in that they are equally devoid of the entities of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: yang mdo dang 'gal ba gzhan gyi lan gdab par 'dod nas phyogs snga ma gzhag pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: yang mdo dang 'gal ba gzhan gyi lan gdab par 'dod nas phyogs snga ma gzhag pa'i phyir ;
translated: Again, wishing to respond to another contradiction with the sutras, in order to posit the opponent's position,

original: gzhan gyi dbang rdzas nyid yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang rdzas nyid yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: he says, If the dependent nature is substantially real, and so on.

original: gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gcig tu rdzas su 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gcig tu rdzas su 'dod na /
translated: If the dependent nature is asserted to be substantially real in one sense,

analyzed: mdo las chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med do zhes ji skad du bshad /
translated: how could it be explained in the sutras that all phenomena are natureless?

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa zhes kyang ji skad du bshad snyam pa la /
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa zhes kyang ji skad du bshad snyam pa la /
translated: How could it be explained that they are unarisen and unceasing?

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas /
translated: The proponent of tenets says,

original: 'gal ba med de zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'gal ba med de zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: There is no contradiction.

original: mdo sde dang 'gal ba ci yang med do //
